definition: to restore (deposed monarch, rule, system of laws, ecological system etc)/restoration
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter

sentences.english: The bulk of the railroad workers voted to go back to work.
sentences.chinese: 大多数铁路工人投票义马市窃听器同意规复事变。

sentences.english: Things will not get back to normal soon after the earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 地动当时统统都不会立刻规复正常。

sentences.english: It will be two weeks before everything returns to normal.
sentences.chinese: 两周之后统统才华规复正常。

sentences.english: This allows good restoration of the soft tissue envelope and can aid stability.
sentences.chinese: 这允许很好的规复软构造外膜，能救助巩固。

sentences.english: A good sleep may help you pick up flesh.
sentences.chinese: 好好睡觉可以救助你病愈后规复体重。

sentences.english: Mobile phone services and power supply were also restored Saturday.
sentences.chinese: 手机处事和电力供应也在周六规复了正常。

sentences.english: So I can't say that he would have restored that.
sentences.chinese: 因此我确实不能说他会使我规复精神。

sentences.english: But it is likely to take some time before power is fully restored.
sentences.chinese: 不外要使电力全面规复大概还需要一段时间。

sentences.english: Our army needs to restore its morale.
sentences.chinese: 我们的部队需要规复士气。

definition: to restore old way/to return to the past
former appearance/what it used to look like
to recover (territory or power)/the liberation of Taiwan from Japanese rule in 1945
Guangfu or Kuangfu township in Hualien County 花蓮縣|花莲县[Hua1 lian2 Xian4], east Taiwan
to fall into disuse (of laws, customs etc)/to neglect
variant of 那麼|那么[na4 me5]
variant of 籌劃|筹划[chou2 hua4]
